attributes.action: launch a Public Inquiry into every aspect of “The Public Arts Centre” project in West Bromwich.  We are appalled at the waste of National Lottery, Central Government and Sandwell Council funds on “The Public Arts Centre” in West Bromwich which has so far cost £63 million, is still not fully open and is likely to require yet more funding.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We are appalled at the entire “The Public Arts Centre” project which we do not believe will serve the needs of the people of Sandwell.  We wish to have a Public Inquiry into, what in our opinion, is a waste of £63 million.  To establish what went wrong and to prevent this waste of public funds happening again.  The inquiry should cover:

1.  The initial idea of the project, how it was conceived, its development and project management.
2.  Whether local people were properly consulted.
3.  The benefits to the people of Sandwell Borough.
4.  The design of the building and its contents.
5.  The awarding of all contracts involved in the project.
6.  The initial budget, financing and budget overruns.
7.  What alternatives the funding could have been spent on i.e. new swimming pools and leisure centres etc.
8.  Recommendation for the future of “The Public Arts Centre”.
9.  Recommendations on how to stop future waste of National Lottery funds.
